title: Assur Archive 27
description: In a house in Assur, between the southwest side of the Anu-Adad temple and the remains of the inner wall of Shalmaneser III, researchers found a small archive of 9 clay tablets and 6 clay envelopes in a clay pot (Room c in WHA). The archive dates the 8th and 7th centuries BC and mostly contain loan documents and receipts recording payments.

properties.description: Representative locations of the Neo-Assyrian archive at Assur on the basis of Peders√©n 1987 Plan(s) 62.
properties.title: Plan location of Assur Archive 27
